overview_of_class: This course provides an introduction to the social, cultural, and intellectual life of the high and later Middle Ages by highlighting both select primary sources as well as modern scholarship. Topics covered in primary and secondary sources will include medieval law, scholasticism, vernacular culture, hagiography, and the inquisition against heretics. The class also highlights critical debates in contemporary historiography, focusing on issues like society's margins as a historical force; the history of the emotions; and religion and coercion. Attention will be given to important theoretical considerations such as gender analysis; Foucauldian perspectives.
name: Field Seminar in Medieval European History
subject: HISTORY
